Package com.example.freeturilo.storage

Class StorageConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.freeturilo.storage.StorageConnector
  • public class StorageConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    A service for internal storage data transaction.

    Object of this class connects to internal storage and handles data transactions of the application. It encapsulates a builder that is used to build connections to the internal storage.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Miko≈Çaj Terzyk
    See Also:
    FAVOURITES_FILE, HISTORY_FILE, context, builder, ensureFileExist(java.lang.String, T), saveToFile(java.lang.String, T), loadFromFile(java.lang.String, java.lang.reflect.Type), saveFavourites(java.util.List<com.example.freeturilo.core.Favourite>), loadFavourites(), saveHistory(java.util.List<com.example.freeturilo.core.RouteParameters>), loadHistory(), addToHistory(com.example.freeturilo.core.RouteParameters), StorageRunnable, StorageConnection

      private static java.lang.String HISTORY_FILE
      Stores name of the internal storage file that contains a serialized history of calculated routes.

        Class constructor.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • ensureFileExist

        @NonNull
private <T> java.lang.Boolean ensureFileExist​(@NonNull
                                              java.lang.String filename,
                                              @NonNull
                                              T defaultContent)
                                       throws StorageException
        Ensures a file exists in internal storage.

        Creates a storage connection, checks if the target file is absent, and if it is, creates it with serialized default content.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the default content object
        Parameters:
        filename - a string equal to the name of the checked file
        defaultContent - an object to serialize to JSON and write to the file if it is created
        Returns:
        true
        Throws:
        StorageException - an exception representing an error which occurred when creating the file with default content

      • saveToFile

        private <T> void saveToFile​(@NonNull
                            java.lang.String filename,
                            @NonNull
                            T object)
                     throws StorageException
        Saves content to an internal storage file.

        Creates a storage connection, opens the target file and overrides its content with a serialized object.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the saved object
        Parameters:
        filename - a string equal to the name of the target file
        object - an object to serialize to JSON and write to the file
        Throws:
        StorageException - an exception representing an error which occurred when writing the object to the file

      • loadFromFile

        @NonNull
private <T> T loadFromFile​(@NonNull
                           java.lang.String filename,
                           @NonNull
                           java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfObject)
                    throws StorageException
        Retrieves content from an internal storage file.

        Creates a storage connection, opens the source file, reads its content and deserializes it to an object.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the retrieved object
        Parameters:
        filename - a string equal to the name of the source file
        typeOfObject - the type of the retrieved object
        Returns:
        an object retrieved over the connection and deserialized from JSON
        Throws:
        StorageException - an exception representing an error which occurred when retrieving the object from the file

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • ensureFavouritesExistAsync

        @NonNull
public java.lang.Thread ensureFavouritesExistAsync​(@Nullable
                                                   StorageHandler handler)
        Asynchronously ensures the FAVOURITES_FILE exists in internal storage. If the file is absent, creates it with a JSON-serialized empty list as initial content.
        Parameters:
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • saveFavouritesAsync

        @NonNull
public java.lang.Thread saveFavouritesAsync​(@NonNull
                                            java.util.List<Favourite> favourites,
                                            @Nullable
                                            StorageHandler handler)
        Asynchronously saves a list of favourite locations to the FAVOURITES_FILE.
        Parameters:
        favourites - a list of all user-favourite locations
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction

      • loadFavouritesAsync

        @NonNull
public java.lang.Thread loadFavouritesAsync​(@Nullable
                                            Callback<java.util.List<Favourite>> callback,
                                            @Nullable
                                            StorageHandler handler)
        Asynchronously loads the list of favourite locations from the FAVOURITES_FILE. The payload of this transaction contains the list of all user-favourite locations.
        Parameters:
        callback - a method to be called when the transaction finishes correctly, takes the payload as a parameter
        handler - a handler to handle potential errors of the transaction
        Returns:
        a dedicated thread that handles the transaction
